Title: Gas Prices
Date: 2022-04-01
Topics: Oil, Fuel Prices, Joe Biden
Content:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Recent letters blame high gas prices on President Biden (or in the case of one
poor confused soul, on someone named "Brandon".)  Are these writers ignorant of
basic economics, enamored of right wing propaganda, crassly manipulative, or all
the above?

I know it, you know it: these folks will continue to blame President Biden even
though they probably don't even believe it themselves.  For everyone else, it's
good to be armed with facts:  Presidents don't affect short-term fuel prices.
The oil market is international.  With a world average (March 9 data) of $4.51 a
gallon, do they think it's to Biden's credit that we are only $4.47?

These writers cannot suggest specific policies causing spikes, as there are
none.  But they will try to blame the Keystone Pipeline cancellation.  When they
do, ask them how this pipeline, not due online until 2023 *at the earliest*, is
affecting current prices.

They will talk about energy independence, about how under Donald Trump we became
a net oil exporter.  An informative chart (http://link.sauyet.com/46) shows net
imports started falling under George W. Bush, then fell sharply under Obama and
Trump, until we hit a balance -- all because of the shale oil boom.  But the
biggest reason for the 2020 change is simple: during the Covid recession, oil
consumption dropped to its lowest level in 25 years.  There was less demand when
the economy tanked.  Those crediting Trump are thanking him for destroying our
economy.  

The economy has performed extremely well under Biden; demand has bounced back.
We're on track to hit record production in 2023.

Oil prices rise for two reasons.  First is a fast-growing economy: Check.
Second is political instability in oil-producing areas, like Russia.  You've
heard of recent problems there?

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Note: 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The letter as submitted was too long to include references.  Here they are.

Country-by-country oil prices as of March 9 (the most recent complete list I
could find) are reported by the [Statistics Times][st1].  The also publish a
list of [populations by country][st2], which I mistakenly thought would use the
same country names.  In order to use this, I had to change approximately twenty
country names to match.  Note that there are more countries in the population
list than in the oil data.  Those are small things like Pallau and the Vatican
city; I simply ignored them in this analysis.  I think that's minor, but if you
have a more complete list, feel free to [email me][ma], and I'll update this.

My calculations are done in plain Javascript, treating those sources as plain
text inputs.  You can see the calculations and the results on [Ramda's
REPL][jc].  The results look like this:

> ```
> USA price: $4.47 per gallon
> World mean price (by population): $4.51 per gallon
> World mean price (by country): $4.90 per gallon
> ```

I can't recall where I first read that the Keystone XL Pipeline was
(optimistically) expected to begin operations in 2023, but an article by
LeadStories [confirms this][ks].  LeadStories is a fact-checking site that is
new to me, but Media Bias Fact Check [rates them highly][mb] for accuracy and
being unbiased.

The chart demonstrating falling oil imports is at [Infogram][ig], and is
repeated here:

<img src="http://fourwindssoft.com/images/OilImports.png" 
     style="margin: 1em 5%; width: 90%" 
     alt="Chart of Oil Prices falling in recent years."/>

But the original source is a [FactCheck page][fc].

Above I used a `link.sauyet.com` reference to that same image.  I do this so that
someone looking at the newspaper article can type it more easily than trying to copy
something like 

> `https://infogram.com/1pj5gp1pme7507u67r7k6n2kz5sm11xnnwq`
    
by hand. Even `bit.ly` urls are difficult with their mixed case identifiers.  So
I set up something trivial at my personal site.  All it does is forward to the
right place.  There is no tracking, nothing weird, just easier-to-type links.

The information about the precipitous drop in U.S. oil consumption is from [The
U.S Energy Information Administration][ea1] as is the [projected record production
numbers][ea2] for 2023.

Arguing that the economy is doing well is far too much for right now, and I
didn't cite particular facts.  But if you want some, check out the links in [two
recent][pk1] [columns][pk2] by Paul Krugman.  Inflation is of course a major
concern, but inflation tends to rise with a strong economy and fall with a
weak one, so high inflation is (tenuous) evidence as well.

----------

Of course none of this addresses the elephant in the room: high oil prices
are a drag on our personal pocketbooks and the economy in general, but if they
help move us away from a carbon economy and toward renewable energy, there is
a very large silver lining.  Because any economic problems and any political 
problems (even a land war in Europe) pale in the face of the largest problem
currently facing humanity: anthropogenic climate change.


  [ea1]: https://www.eia.gov/todayinenergy/detail.php?id=49016
  [ea2]: https://www.eia.gov/todayinenergy/detail.php?id=51318
  [fc]:  https://www.factcheck.org/2022/03/examining-u-s-energy-independence-claims/
  [ig]:  https://infogram.com/1pj5gp1pme7507u67r7k6n2kz5sm11xnnwq
  [jc]: Asia%0AGermany%0983%2C783%2C945%0919%0983%2C900%2C471%0919%091.07%09116%2C526%090.14%090%09Europe%0AThailand%0969%2C799%2C978%0920%0969%2C950%2C844%0920%090.888%09150%2C866%090.22%090%09Asia%0AUnited%20Kingdom%0967%2C886%2C004%0921%0968%2C207%2C114%0921%090.866%09321%2C110%090.47%090%09Europe%0AFrance%0965%2C273%2C512%0922%0965%2C426%2C177%0922%090.831%09152%2C665%090.23%090%09Europe%0ATanzania%0959%2C734%2C213%0924%0961%2C498%2C438%0923%090.781%091%2C764%2C225%092.95%09%2B1%09Africa%0AItaly%0960%2C461%2C828%0923%0960%2C367%2C471%0924%090.767%09-94%2C357%09-0.16%09-1%09Europe%0ASouth%20Africa%0959%2C308%2C690%0925%0960%2C041%2C996%0925%090.762%09733%2C306%091.24%090%09Africa%0AKenya%0953%2C771%2C300%0927%0954%2C985%2C702%0926%090.698%091%2C214%2C402%092.26%09%2B1%09Africa%0ABurma%0954%2C409%2C794%0926%0954%2C806%2C014%0927%090.696%09396%2C220%090.73%09-1%09Asia%0ARepublic%20of%20Korea%0951%2C269%2C183%0928%0951%2C305%2C184%0928%090.651%0936%2C001%090.07%090%09Asia%0AColombia%0950%2C882%2C884%0929%0951%2C265%2C841%0929%090.651%09382%2C957%090.75%090%09South%20America%0AUganda%0945%2C741%2C000%0931%0947%2C123%2C533%0930%090.598%091%2C382%2C533%093.02%09%2B1%09Africa%0ASpain%0946%2C754%2C783%0930%0946%2C745%2C211%0931%090.594%09-9%2C572%09-0.02%09-1%09Europe%0AArgentina%0945%2C195%2C777%0932%0945%2C605%2C823%0932%090.579%09410%2C046%090.91%090%09South%20America%0ASudan%0943%2C849%2C269%0934%0944%2C909%2C351%0933%090.570%091%2C060%2C082%092.42%09%2B1%09Africa%0AAlgeria%0943%2C851%2C043%0933%0944%2C616%2C626%0934%090.567%09765%2C583%091.75%09-1%09Africa%0AUkraine%0943%2C733%2C759%0935%0943%2C466%2C822%0935%090.552%09-266%2C937%09-0.61%090%09Europe%0AIraq%0940%2C222%2C503%0936%0941%2C179%2C351%0936%090.523%09956%2C848%092.38%090%09Asia%0AAfghanistan%0938%2C928%2C341%0937%0939%2C835%2C428%0937%090.506%09907%2C087%092.33%090%09Asia%0ACanada%0937%2C742%2C157%0939%0938%2C067%2C913%0938%090.483%09325%2C756%090.86%09%2B1%09North%20America%0APoland%0937%2C846%2C605%0938%0937%2C797%2C000%0939%090.480%09-49%2C605%09-0.13%09-1%09Europe%0AMorocco%0936%2C910%2C558%0940%0937%2C344%2C787%0940%090.474%09434%2C229%091.18%090%09Africa%0ASaudi%20Arabia%0934%2C813%2C867%0941%0935%2C340%2C680%0941%090.449%09526%2C813%091.51%090%09Asia%0AUzbekistan%0933%2C469%2C199%0942%0933%2C935%2C765%0942%090.431%09466%2C566%091.39%090%09Asia%0AAngola%0932%2C866%2C268%0944%0933%2C933%2C611%0943%090.431%091%2C067%2C343%093.25%09%2B1%09Africa%0APeru%0932%2C971%2C846%0943%0933%2C359%2C416%0944%090.424%09387%2C570%091.18%09-1%09South%20America%0AMalaysia%0932%2C365%2C998%0945%0932%2C776%2C195%0945%090.416%09410%2C197%091.27%090%09Asia%0AMozambique%0931%2C255%2C435%0946%0932%2C163%2C045%0946%090.408%09907%2C610%092.90%090%09Africa%0AGhana%0931%2C072%2C945%0947%0931%2C732%2C128%0947%090.403%09659%2C183%092.12%090%09Africa%0AYemen%0929%2C825%2C968%0948%0930%2C490%2C639%0948%090.387%09664%2C671%092.23%090%09Asia%0ANepal%0929%2C136%2C808%0949%0929%2C674%2C920%0949%090.377%09538%2C112%091.85%090%09Asia%0AVenezuela%0928%2C435%2C943%0950%0928%2C704%2C947%0950%090.365%09269%2C004%090.95%090%09South%20America%0AMadagascar%0927%2C691%2C019%0951%0928%2C427%2C333%0951%090.361%09736%2C314%092.66%090%09Africa%0ACameroon%0926%2C545%2C864%0952%0927%2C224%2C262%0952%090.346%09678%2C398%092.56%090%09Africa%0AIvory%20Coast%0926%2C378%2C275%0953%0927%2C053%2C629%0953%090.344%09675%2C354%092.56%090%09Africa%0ASouth%20Korea%0925%2C778%2C815%0954%0925%2C887%2C045%0954%090.329%09108%2C230%090.42%090%09Asia%0AAustralia%0925%2C499%2C881%0955%0925%2C788%2C217%0955%090.327%09288%2C336%091.13%090%09Oceania%0ANiger%0924%2C206%2C636%0956%0925%2C130%2C810%0956%090.319%09924%2C174%093.82%090%09Africa%0ATaiwan%0923%2C816%2C775%0957%0923%2C855%2C008%0957%090.303%0938%2C233%090.16%090%09Asia%0ASri%20Lanka%0921%2C413%2C250%0958%0921%2C497%2C306%0958%090.273%0984%2C056%090.39%090%09Asia%0ABurkina%20Faso%0920%2C903%2C278%0959%0921%2C497%2C097%0959%090.273%09593%2C819%092.84%090%09Africa%0AMali%0920%2C250%2C834%0960%0920%2C855%2C724%0960%090.265%09604%2C890%092.99%090%09Africa%0AMalawi%0919%2C129%2C955%0962%0919%2C647%2C681%0961%090.249%09517%2C726%092.71%09%2B1%09Africa%0AChile%0919%2C116%2C209%0963%0919%2C212%2C362%0962%090.244%0996%2C153%090.50%09%2B1%09South%20America%0ARomania%0919%2C237%2C682%0961%0919%2C127%2C772%0963%090.243%09-109%2C910%09-0.57%09-2%09Europe%0AKazakhstan%0918%2C776%2C707%0964%0918%2C994%2C958%0964%090.241%09218%2C251%091.16%090%09Asia%0AZambia%0918%2C383%2C956%0965%0918%2C920%2C657%0965%090.240%09536%2C701%092.92%090%09Africa%0ASyria%0917%2C500%2C657%0968%0918%2C275%2C704%0966%090.232%09775%2C047%094.43%09%2B2%09Asia%0AGuatemala%0917%2C915%2C567%0966%0918%2C249%2C868%0967%090.232%09334%2C301%091.87%09-1%09North%20America%0AEcuador%0917%2C643%2C060%0967%0917%2C888%2C474%0968%090.227%09245%2C414%091.39%09-1%09South%20America%0ASenegal%0916%2C743%2C930%0970%0917%2C196%2C308%0969%090.218%09452%2C378%092.70%09%2B1%09Africa%0ANetherlands%0917%2C134%2C873%0969%0917%2C173%2C094%0970%090.218%0938%2C221%090.22%09-1%09Europe%0ACambodia%0916%2C718%2C971%0971%0916%2C946%2C446%0971%090.215%09227%2C475%091.36%090%09Asia%0AChad%0916%2C425%2C859%0972%0916%2C914%2C985%0972%090.215%09489%2C126%092.98%090%09Africa%0ASomalia%0915%2C893%2C219%0973%0916%2C359%2C500%0973%090.208%09466%2C281%092.93%090%09Africa%0AZimbabwe%0914%2C862%2C927%0974%0915%2C092%2C171%0974%090.192%09229%2C244%091.54%090%09Africa%0AGuinea%0913%2C132%2C792%0975%0913%2C497%2C237%0975%090.171%09364%2C445%092.78%090%09Africa%0ARwanda%0912%2C952%2C209%0976%0913%2C276%2C517%0976%090.169%09324%2C308%092.50%090%09Africa%0ABenin%0912%2C123%2C198%0977%0912%2C451%2C031%0977%090.158%09327%2C833%092.70%090%09Africa%0ABurundi%0911%2C890%2C781%0978%0912%2C255%2C429%0978%090.156%09364%2C648%093.07%090%09Africa%0ATunisia%0911%2C818%2C618%0979%0911%2C935%2C764%0979%090.152%09117%2C146%090.99%090%09Africa%0ABolivia%0911%2C673%2C029%0980%0911%2C832%2C936%0980%090.150%09159%2C907%091.37%090%09South%20America%0ABelgium%0911%2C589%2C616%0981%0911%2C632%2C334%0981%090.148%0942%2C718%090.37%090%09Europe%0AHaiti%0911%2C402%2C533%0982%0911%2C541%2C683%0982%090.147%09139%2C150%091.22%090%09North%20America%0ASouth%20Sudan%0911%2C193%2C729%0984%0911%2C381%2C377%0983%090.145%09187%2C648%091.68%09%2B1%09Africa%0ACuba%0911%2C326%2C616%0983%0911%2C317%2C498%0984%090.144%09-9%2C118%09-0.08%09-1%09North%20America%0ADominican%20Republic%0910%2C847%2C904%0985%0910%2C953%2C714%0985%090.139%09105%2C810%090.98%090%09North%20America%0ACzech%20Republic%0910%2C708%2C982%0986%0910%2C724%2C553%0986%090.136%0915%2C571%090.15%090%09Europe%0AGreece%0910%2C423%2C056%0987%0910%2C370%2C747%0987%090.132%09-52%2C309%09-0.50%090%09Europe%0AJordan%0910%2C203%2C140%0988%0910%2C269%2C022%0988%090.130%0965%2C882%090.65%090%09Asia%0AAzerbaijan%0910%2C139%2C175%0990%0910%2C223%2C344%0989%090.130%0984%2C169%090.83%09%2B1%09Asia%0APortugal%0910%2C196%2C707%0989%0910%2C167%2C923%0990%090.129%09-28%2C784%09-0.28%09-1%09Europe%0ASweden%0910%2C099%2C270%0991%0910%2C160%2C159%0991%090.129%0960%2C889%090.60%090%09Europe%0AHonduras%099%2C904%2C608%0992%0910%2C062%2C994%0992%090.128%09158%2C386%091.60%090%09North%20America%0AUnited%20Arab%20Emirates%099%2C890%2C400%0993%099%2C991%2C083%0993%090.127%09100%2C683%091.02%090%09Asia%0ATajikistan%099%2C537%2C642%0995%099%2C749%2C625%0994%090.124%09211%2C983%092.22%09%2B1%09Asia%0AHungary%099%2C660%2C350%0994%099%2C634%2C162%0995%090.122%09-26%2C188%09-0.27%09-1%09Europe%0ABelarus%099%2C449%2C321%0996%099%2C442%2C867%0996%090.120%09-6%2C454%09-0.07%090%09Europe%0APapua%20New%20Guinea%098%2C947%2C027%0998%099%2C119%2C005%0997%090.116%09171%2C978%091.92%09%2B1%09Oceania%0AAustria%099%2C006%2C400%0997%099%2C043%2C072%0998%090.115%0936%2C672%090.41%09-1%09Europe%0AIsrael%098%2C655%2C541%09100%098%2C789%2C776%0999%090.112%09134%2C235%091.55%09%2B1%09Asia%0ASwitzerland%098%2C654%2C618%09101%098%2C715%2C494%09100%090.111%0960%2C876%090.70%09%2B1%09Europe%0ASerbia%098%2C737%2C370%0999%098%2C
